description: Infill extension to existing rear roof extension by infilling the central section and installation of two roof lights to front roof slope (replacing the existing rooflight)
decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990. | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing / document title number(s): Proposed Grd Floor Plan drawing no.P-01, Proposed First Floor Floor Plan drawing no.P-02, Proposed Loft Floor Plan drawing no.P-03, Proposed Roof Floor Plan drawing no.P-04, Proposed Front Elevation drawing no.P-05, Proposed Rear Elevation drawing no.P-06, Proposed Side Elevation drawing no.P-07, Proposed Side Elevation drawing no.P-08, Proposed Side Section drawing no.P-09 and Proposed 3D Illustrative Plan P-10

Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning. | All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building, unless otherwise stated in the submitted application form or approved drawings.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2024).
| The hereby approved two rooflights to the front roof slope shall be Conservation style rooflights and lie flush with the roof and shall be retained as such for the lifetime of the development.

Reason:  To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, and to safeguard the character and appearance of the conservation area in accordance with policies D4 and HC1 of the London Plan (2021), policies 7B and 7C of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and policy DAA of Ealing's Local Plan (Reg.22).
